intro: Cryptocarya scalariformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly in the temperate regions of New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue or black berries. Cryptocarya scalariformis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys.
